captions.text: I'm Andrew
I'm Kevin
Welcome to Brojects!
Remember that time I hit Walker in the eye with the apple?
Who knew I had such an underhand!
Put it on your head for a sec...I think I can definitely shoot that off your head you know
I'd aim way high so it didn't hit you
Competition?
I'll make a bow, you make a bow...say you've gotta shoot uh
You've got a remarkably flat head!
Incredible balance
Both of us have wanted to make a bow for a little while
I think I've got a reasonable idea...
I think it's going to be a fun competition too...I love beating Andrew at stuff!
How would you know? Have you done it?
I've won every single one of them!

We have some PVC pipe kicking around
here from a previous project
I don't exactly know how I'm going to do mine...Kevin seems to have a bit of a plan for his
I'm using some driveway markers, they're just fiberglass rods
you put them inside the pipe it stiffins it

gives it more resistance and prevents it
from crimping
So, I'm just kind of trying to size them so I use these
driveway markers as efficiently as I can
Hope this fits in

I'm getting pretty close so I thought
I'd give junior the helping hand he usually needs
I found another piece of PVC pipe so what I think I'm gonna try and do
is cut away a section of this

so essentially rip it down the middle so
I can squeeze it
shove it into the other PVC pipe
You're never going to get a good cut on that with the skill-saw
Work on yours
Oh god that wreaks!
We're breathing in some very nasty crap right now!
Get that cooking spray here
You've done it!
Yeah, we've finishing up our bow and arrows now we just need to string them
Lets test that one
Get on there!
Right now I'm just going to cover the bow with some tape here...make it look a little better
I got a couple quivers for us! A little rubber boot action
Robin Boot!
It looks like it's good guys versus bad guys!
These are going to go hard
I think they are...are you wearing glasses? Incase something like explodes
What do you think of the quiver?
I like it man...it's just a boot perfect!
Let's go!
This is going to be fun!
Did you set up a target?
We've got a hay bail? You wanna set that up and get some targets?
Yea definitely!
Should we set it up on a broad side of a barn for you?
Loser does 20 pushups
The deer are safe
In the target!
Alright that was a practice one
You're not even reaching the target!
But can you do it with a distraction?
I'm feeling this is gonna break my hands
Count them out!
One! Two!
Ah...twenty!
How was that?
Cold on the hands!
Alright Maid Marian! See what you've got
You really think you should be teasing me?
For real...shoot this one straight!
Can you believe that I did that with my eyes closed?
Right in the middle of the apple to
Still tasty...It's like a skewer!

Basically this is really simple build
we're going to build two legs
Connect it with dowel to form a free-standing structure and for that we're gonna need
two two by four by eight
and six feet of one inch dowel
Here's our cutting list. Out of each two by four you're going to cut a three foot six
two two foot pieces and two three inch pieces
basically we're gonna build a sandwich

comments.text:
You put the arrow on the left or right side of the bow depending on your 
release. Assuming your right handed the arrow goes on the right side if 
your using a thumb draw and on the left side if your using a Mediterranean 
draw.

comments.author: PaperWeaponry

comments.text:
+brickstar56 Twisting the bow only gives the arrow a bit more push and the 
end and lets the arrow fly straighter. But damn, there are so many ways to 
shoot an arrow. (Actually on either side of the bow but meh whatever)
comments.author: PaperWeaponry

comments.text:
+PaperWeaponry Thats Not Ment to happen (the bow spins round after the 
arrow shot) it's because you dont/didnt have a strong grip on the Bow. And 
like Cycronos said in lots of traditional Archery Types (not just Japanese 
Styles) the Arrow is Shot on the same side as you are handed. It Allows 
more Power and Accuracy (dont really know how) and  use it when i do 
archery and it works :3 :D
comments.author: NinthCore

comments.text:
+brickstar56 You don't need to spin them! Think about the smooth bore on an 
Abram tank, the projectile has stabilizer fins like an arrow as is DEAD 
accurate while keeping maximum velocity.
comments.author: manvstaco

comments.text:
Theoretically, yes, provided the twist happens as long as the arrow is 
still in contact with the string. (a fraction of a second after release) 
But only minimally in reality, if at all. If you want the arrow to spin you 
put on the feathers or vanes in a spirally pattern.
comments.author: Cycronos

comments.text:
+PaperWeaponry I don't know any thing about archery but does twisting the 
bow cause the arrow to spin while flying, like a barrels rifling would to a 
bullet. Sorry if this sounds stupid again I'm more of a gun guy than an 
archer.

incredibly painful and dangerous. You really shouldn't do it especially 
with a non-tapered bow like one of them has.
